When kids read for thirty minutes, they earn extra tokens. Those tokens can be traded for screen time or cash. The results? Mind-blowing. Screen time dropped by 90%, while reading shot up the same amount. Plus, we spent way less time managing the whole thing. Basically, nonessential activities plummeted, and essential ones skyrocketed. Once we set up the system with a bit of effort, it ran smoothly.

We can create similar systems at home or work. The trick is to start small, encourage progress, and celebrate little wins. Here are some tips.
